content.title: machine learning (Wiktionary)
content.author: Wiktionary contributors
content.text:
machine learning definition: A field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed.

machine learning definition: A type of artificial intelligence that provides computers with the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed.

machine learning definition: The subfield of computer science that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed.

Example: Machine learning algorithms can identify patterns in large datasets automatically.

Example: The machine learning model was trained on thousands of images to recognize objects.

Example: Companies use machine learning to improve their recommendation systems.
